intro: Campanula stylosa, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers, which are usually blue to violet in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Campanula stylosa is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively low maintenance.
